businessSummary.oneLiner: Government and enterprise AI data analytics platform ‚Äî transforming from core US defense/intelligence partner to commercial AI powerhouse
businessSummary.description: Palantir builds software platforms that analyze and integrate complex data. Since launching AIP (AI Platform), the commercial segment has exploded. Q4 2025 revenue $1.407B (+70% YoY), US commercial revenue $507M (+137% YoY). Recent developments include DHS $1B 5-year BPA, Rackspace AI infrastructure partnership expansion, and Mizuho Outperform upgrade. However, stock is down 24%+ in 2026 amid a broader software sector selloff.
howTheyMakeMoney: US Government: DoD, CIA, NSA, DHS data analytics platform ‚Äî Q4 $570M (+66% YoY)
US Commercial: Enterprise AI and data analytics ‚Äî Q4 $507M (+137% YoY), fastest growing segment
International Government: NATO allies and other foreign government contracts
International Commercial: Global enterprise customers (Airbus Skywise, etc.)
Subscription-based SaaS model: Annual contracts, top 20 customers averaging $94M/year (+45% YoY)
keyProducts: AIP (Artificial Intelligence Platform) ‚Äî Enterprise AI integration platform, core growth engine
Gotham ‚Äî Government/defense data analysis and decision-making platform
Foundry ‚Äî Enterprise data integration and operations platform
Apollo ‚Äî Software deployment automation and management infrastructure
TITAN ‚Äî US Army next-generation intelligence system (major contract)

keyMetrics.name: P/E (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Based on FY2025 net income of $1.63B. High valuation but growth premium justified by 137% growth rate

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth (YoY)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Accelerating from FY2024's 28.8%. AIP-driven explosive commercial AI adoption

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Major improvement from FY2024's 10.8%. Economies of scale and SaaS structure reflected

keyMetrics.name: Net Income
keyMetrics.interpretation: +251% YoY. Rapid profit growth following profitability turnaround

keyMetrics.name: US Commercial Revenue Growth
keyMetrics.interpretation: Fastest growing segment. Explosive enterprise AI demand driven by AIP

keyMetrics.name: RPO (Remaining Performance Obligations)
keyMetrics.interpretation: +$1.6B increase. Reflects large contracts including DHS BPA

keyMetrics.name: Market Cap
keyMetrics.interpretation: 67x revenue. AI premium heavily reflected in valuation

keyMetrics.name: Free Cash Flow
keyMetrics.interpretation: Rule of 40+ achieved. Meeting both growth and profitability criteria

growthDrivers.title: DHS $1B 5-Year BPA ‚Äî Procurement Without Competitive Bidding
growthDrivers.description: Signed $1B 5-year BPA with Department of Homeland Security (confirmed 2/19). CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA and other DHS agencies can procure Palantir software without competitive bidding. RPO surged from $2.6B to $4.2B (+$1.6B).

growthDrivers.title: Rackspace Partnership ‚Äî 30‚Üí250+ Dedicated Engineers, UK Sovereign Data Center
growthDrivers.description: Strategic AI deployment partnership officially announced (2/18). Operating Foundry and AIP on Rackspace Private Cloud and UK Sovereign data centers. Dedicated engineers expanding from 30 to 250+ within 12 months.

growthDrivers.title: US Commercial Revenue +137% ‚Äî AIP-Driven Explosive Growth
growthDrivers.description: Q4 US commercial revenue $507M (+137% YoY). Top 20 customers averaging $94M/year (+45% YoY). US commercial deal value backlog $4.38B (+145% YoY).

growthDrivers.title: DISA IL5/IL6 On-Premises/Edge Authorization + Airbus Skywise Renewal
growthDrivers.description: PFCS Forward IL5/IL6 authorization (2/12) formally expanding defense on-premises and edge deployments. Airbus renewed multi-year Skywise data platform contract (50K+ daily users).

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Unrivaled #1 in government/defense AI, rapidly building commercial AI position with AIP. Irreplaceable in data security + AI integration.

moats.description: Holds highest-level clearances from CIA, NSA, DHS. DHS BPA enables procurement without competitive bidding. DISA IL5/IL6 on-premises/edge authorization. Competitors need years to obtain equivalent clearances.
More customers improve AI models, better models attract more customers ‚Äî a virtuous cycle.
Deeply integrated into customer data infrastructure. Airbus multi-year renewal and DHS 5-year BPA demonstrate stickiness.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.detail: Data cloud platform expanding AI capabilities but weak in government sector.

competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.detail: Private company, data lakehouse. Competing in enterprise AI.

competitors.name: C3.ai
competitors.detail: Enterprise AI platform. Significantly behind in growth rate and scale.

competitors.name: Percepta AI
competitors.detail: Founded by former key Palantir employees. Non-compete injunction dismissed, free to compete.

recentNews.headline: Forbes: Palantir Building Setup for Next Major Rally
recentNews.significance: Technical setup similar to patterns preceding 50%+ surges in 2020 and 2024.

recentNews.headline: PLTR Down Additional -1.35% in Software Selloff, -24%+ YTD 2026
recentNews.significance: Broad AI software sector valuation adjustment. Macro-driven, not fundamental.

recentNews.headline: DHS $1B 5-Year BPA Signed ‚Äî No Competitive Bidding Required
recentNews.significance: Dramatically expands government revenue pipeline. RPO at all-time high of $4.2B.

recentNews.headline: Rackspace AI Partnership Details Announced ‚Äî 250+ Dedicated Engineers
recentNews.significance: Significantly expanding commercial AI deployment channels. Accelerating enterprise customer acquisition.

recentNews.headline: Q4 2025 Earnings ‚Äî Revenue $1.41B (+70% YoY), EPS $0.25 Beat
recentNews.significance: 6th consecutive beat. AIP-driven growth acceleration confirmed.

analystOpinions.notableComment: Consensus 'Buy' among 20 analysts. Average target $187.95 (+45.9%). Mizuho Outperform $195. Despite 1,200% 3-year return, Michael Burry presents $46 bear case ‚Äî extreme bull/bear divide.

risks.title: Extreme Valuation ‚Äî P/S 67x, P/E 183x
risks.description: 67x revenue, 183x earnings. Sharp derating risk on growth deceleration. Michael Burry's $46 bear case reflects this.

risks.title: 2026 Software Selloff ‚Äî Down 24%+ YTD
risks.description: Broad AI software sector valuation adjustment. Growing market skepticism toward high-valuation growth stocks.

risks.title: Ongoing Insider Selling
risks.description: CEO Alex Karp and other insiders continuously selling shares. Raises concerns about management's view of current valuation.

risks.title: Percepta AI Competitive Threat
risks.description: Non-compete injunction for Percepta AI (founded by former key employees) dismissed, enabling free competition. Talent drain risk.

risks.title: Government Budget Cut Potential
risks.description: DOGE and government efficiency movements could reduce some contracts. However, long-term contracts like DHS BPA provide buffer.

buyReasons.title: AIP-Driven US Commercial Revenue +137% ‚Äî Record Growth
buyReasons.rationale: Enterprise AI adoption in early stages. Deal value backlog $4.38B (+145% YoY) indicates sustained growth momentum.

buyReasons.title: DHS $1B BPA + RPO $4.2B ‚Äî All-Time High Revenue Visibility
buyReasons.rationale: 5-year contract without competitive bidding. Pipeline at record highs across both government and commercial.

buyReasons.title: Government Security Clearances ‚Äî Multi-Year Insurmountable Moat
buyReasons.rationale: Highest-level clearances from CIA, NSA, DHS. DISA IL5/IL6 expands defense on-premises. Extremely high competitor entry barriers.

buyReasons.title: 24% Correction as Long-Term Buying Opportunity?
buyReasons.rationale: Macro-driven selloff, not fundamental deterioration. Historical pattern of reaching new all-time highs after every major correction.

overallOpinion: Palantir has built an unrivaled position in government and enterprise AI platforms. Q4 revenue +70%, US commercial +137%, RPO $4.2B are flawless results.
However, P/S 67x and P/E 183x valuations price in 'perfect execution.' The 24%+ YTD 2026 correction shows the market is re-evaluating this premium.
Technically, RSI 34.5 entering oversold territory. Below both 50-day (165.2) and 200-day (161.15) SMAs. Further short-term decline possible but oversold bounce potential exists.

For long-term investors, dollar-cost averaging starting below $110 is reasonable (Motley Fool view). Long-term growth potential as AI software leader remains significant, but patience needed at current valuation.
